# test-rawg
Game library using RAWG Api. It filters games based on selected genres. You can search for your favorite games of the chosen genres. Then, open a game from a list to learn more about it.

# Architecture
This Project is written in Kotlin and uses Jetpack Compose and Flows to bring data to the presentation layer. It uses RAWG Api to search for games, based on the API key you receive when registering on <a href="https://rawg.io/apidocs">RAWG docs site</a>.

To keep the API key secret and prevent reverse engineering we use <a href="https://github.com/google/secrets-gradle-plugin">secrets gradle plugin</a>. Inside secrets.defaults.properties we added default values that are tracked in version control. Real data is defined in secrets.properties and this is not included in version control. To test the app you either adjust values in secrets.defaults.properties or create the secrets.properties file with the same keys but correct values.

Navigation is done via the new Type Safe Jetpack Navigation, however this is still in beta. Regardless it is much cleaner than defining Routes in the old-fashioned web type navigation with Strings. And we also get type safety. The biggest drawback is having to get the current Route via the qualifier name of the class, hopefully, this will be fixed in newer updates.

For internal storage, Room library is used. Here we use it to save the ids of the followed genres. It offers us a Flow to keep track of the changes.

Games list is a paginated response, which is why we use Android paging library. It simplifies the need to track pages, errors, loadings and refresh.
